com.kuka.device

Class RoboticArm

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.kuka.geometry.SpatialObject
      • com.kuka.geometry.SerialKinematics
        • com.kuka.device.RoboticArm
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    com.kuka.capabilities.ICapabilityContainer, com.kuka.geometry.IRobotFlange

    public class RoboticArm
extends com.kuka.geometry.SerialKinematics
    A RoboticArm is a device which can hold a tool and do some simple motions out of the box. Furthermore, it can be used in complex motions as a device.

    This type can be instantiated in applications and background tasks via dependency injection, using @Inject, @Named etc.
    The @Named annotation can be used to differentiate between different objects of the same type like process data.
    More detailed information including code examples can be found in the documentation of the base class of the application or background task.

        Returns:
        A copy of the current measured joint positions of the robot.

      • getHomePosition

        public com.kuka.device.common.JointPosition getHomePosition()
        Returns the home position of this robot.

        The home position is a user-defined joint position.

        Returns:
        The home position of this robot.

      • setHomePosition

        public void setHomePosition(com.kuka.device.common.JointPosition homePosition)
        Sets the home position for this robot.
        Parameters:
        homePosition - The new home position for the robot. The amount of values must match the joint count of the robot. Otherwise an exception will be thrown.

      • setHomePosition

        public void setHomePosition(com.kuka.geometry.Frame home)
        Sets the home position for the robot.

        The given frame will be converted to a unique joint position. Thus, redundancy information is required for this frame. If no redundancy information is available, an IllegalArgumentException is thrown.

        Parameters:
        home - A frame with redundancy information (e.g. a teached frame) defining the new home position.

      • getInverseKinematicFromFrameAndRedundancy

        public com.kuka.device.common.JointPosition getInverseKinematicFromFrameAndRedundancy(com.kuka.geometry.Frame frame)
        Gets the inverse kinematics value of the given flange frame for this robot.

        If the frame contains redundancy information, these are used for the computation. If the frame does not contain redundancy information, an IllegalArgumentException is thrown.

        Parameters:
        frame - The flange frame for which the inverse kinematics is requested.
        Returns:
        The result of the calculation from the controller.

      • getInverseKinematics

        public com.kuka.device.common.JointPosition getInverseKinematics(com.kuka.math.geometry.ITransformation trafo,
                                                                 com.kuka.device.common.JointPosition correspondingJoints)
        Gets the inverse kinematics value of the given flange transformation matrix for this robot.
        Parameters:
        trafo - The flange transformation matrix for which the inverse kinematics is requested.
        correspondingJoints - The optional reference joint configuration. If there are multiple solutions, the solution closest to this reference configuration is returned.
        Returns:
        The joint position returned from the controller.

      • getJointLimits

        public JointLimits getJointLimits()
        Gets the JointLimits for this robot.
        Returns:
        the joint limits of the robot in radiant

      • getCurrentCartesianPosition

        public com.kuka.geometry.LocalFrame getCurrentCartesianPosition(com.kuka.geometry.Frame frameOnFlange,
                                                                com.kuka.geometry.Frame reference)
        Gets the current cartesian position of the specified frame in the frame tree below the flange of the robot relative to the given reference frame.

        Additionally, this method fills the created frame with the redundancy information for the robot.

        Parameters:
        frameOnFlange - The frame below or equal to the flange of the robot. null is not allowed
        reference - The reference frame. null is not allowed.
        Returns:
        The new frame with redundancy information. The parent for the new frame is the reference frame.

      • getCurrentCartesianPosition

        public final com.kuka.geometry.LocalFrame getCurrentCartesianPosition(com.kuka.geometry.Frame frameOnFlange)
        Gets the current cartesian position of the specified frame in the frame tree below the flange of the robot relative to WORLD base frame SpatialObject.getRootFrame().

        The returned frame is a new instance of the LocalFrame class.
        Additionally, this method fills the frame with frame information describing the redundancy values for the robot.

        Parameters:
        frameOnFlange - The frame below or equal to the flange of the robot. null is not allowed
        Returns:
        The new frame with frame redundancy information. The parent for the new frame is the WORLD root frame.

      • getCommandedCartesianPosition

        public final com.kuka.geometry.LocalFrame getCommandedCartesianPosition(com.kuka.geometry.Frame frameOnFlange,
                                                                        com.kuka.geometry.Frame reference)
        Gets the commanded cartesian position of the specified frame in the frame tree below the flange of the robot relative to the given reference frame.

        The returned frame is a new instance of the LocalFrame class including the redundancy information of the robot.

        Parameters:
        frameOnFlange - The frame below or equal to the flange of the robot. null is not allowed
        reference - The reference frame. null is not allowed.
        Returns:
        The new frame with redundancy information. The parent for the new frame is the reference frame.

      • getCommandedCartesianPosition

        public final com.kuka.geometry.LocalFrame getCommandedCartesianPosition(com.kuka.geometry.Frame frameOnFlange)
        Gets the commanded cartesian position of the specified frame in the frame tree below the flange of the robot relative to WORLD base frame SpatialObject.getRootFrame().

        The returned frame is a new instance of the LocalFrame class including the redundancy information of the robot.

        Parameters:
        frameOnFlange - The frame below or equal to the flange of the robot. null is not allowed
        Returns:
        The new frame with redundancy information. The parent for the new frame is the WORLD base frame.

      • getPositionInformation

        public final com.kuka.device.common.PositionInformation getPositionInformation(com.kuka.geometry.Frame frameOnFlange,
                                                                               com.kuka.geometry.Frame reference)
        Gets information about the current and commanded position of the specified frame in the frame tree below the flange of the robot relative to the given reference frame.
        Parameters:
        frameOnFlange - The frame below or equal to the flange of the robot. null is not allowed
        reference - The reference frame. null is not allowed.
        Returns:
        The position information. The frames contained in the returned PositionInformation are new instances of the LocalFrame class containing the redundancy information of the robot.

      • getPositionInformation

        public final com.kuka.device.common.PositionInformation getPositionInformation(com.kuka.geometry.Frame frameOnFlange)
        Gets information about the current and commanded position of the specified frame in the frame tree below the flange of the robot relative to WORLD base frame SpatialObject.getRootFrame().
        Parameters:
        frameOnFlange - The frame below or equal to the flange of the robot. null is not allowed
        Returns:
        The position information. The frames contained in the returned PositionInformation are new instances of the LocalFrame class containing the redundancy information of the robot.

      • getCommandedJointPosition

        public com.kuka.device.common.JointPosition getCommandedJointPosition()
        Gets the commanded joint positions for this robot.
        Returns:
        The commanded joint positions.

      • isMastered

        public boolean isMastered()
        Checks whether all joints of this robot are mastered. This means that all joints are adjusted.
        Returns:
        true if all joints of this robot are mastered

      • hasActiveMotionCommand

        public boolean hasActiveMotionCommand()
        Returns true if the robot is currently executing a motion command, for example by jogging or from a running application. This includes PositionHold.
        Returns:
        True if this robot is currently executing a motion command

      • calculateLoadOnFlange

        public com.kuka.geometry.LoadData calculateLoadOnFlange()
        Calculates the combined load data of all objects that are attached to the flange of this robot.

        The robot itself is not included in the calculations.

        Returns:
        the calculated LoadData of all PhysicalObject, that are attached to the flange of the robot.

      • checkFrameContainsRedundancy

        public boolean checkFrameContainsRedundancy(com.kuka.geometry.Frame frame)
        Checks if the specified frame contains redundancy information for this robot.
        Parameters:
        frame - frame to check
        Returns:
        true if the specified frame contains redundancy information for this robot.

      • isInHome

        public boolean isInHome()
        Returns true if the robot is in its home position, i.e. its commanded joint position is close to the home position, and false otherwise.
        Returns:
        true if the robot is in its home position, and false otherwise.

      • detachChildrenFromFlange

        public void detachChildrenFromFlange()
        Detaches all objects attached to the flange of the robot.

      • isReadyToMove

        public boolean isReadyToMove()
        Checks whether the robot is ready to move.

        A robot is ready to move if a movement command can be executed. For a general robot this method returns true if the SafetyStopType is SafetyStopType.NOSTOP and the drives are ready (not in an error state).

        Returns:
        true, if the device is ready to move at this moment:
      • the SafetyStopType is SafetyStopType.NOSTOP,
      • AND the drives are ready (not in an error state).
        • false, otherwise

      • getForwardKinematics

        public final com.kuka.device.common.Pose getForwardKinematics(com.kuka.device.common.JointPosition joints)
        Gets the flange forward kinematics value of the given joints for this robot.
        Parameters:
        joints - The joints for which the flange forward kinematics is requested.
        Returns:
        The flange Cartesian position.
